                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For a number to be a multiple of 3, 5, and 7, it must be a multiple of 105, or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \times 5 \times 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". As there are only 100 possibilities for what "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"120ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is, there must be only one of those that can be a multiple of 105."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's divide 12000 and 12099 by 105 and see if we can get a whole number:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12000÷105≈114.3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12099÷105≈115.2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we know that the number divided by 105 has to be 115."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the number is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"115 \times 105 = 12075"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{75}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In order for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{120ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be divisible by 5, either "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In order for the number to be divisible by 3, the sum of the digits must be divisible by 3, which means that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be divisible by 3. We can split this problem into two cases; if the units digit "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is 5 or 0."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be divisible by 3 in order for the number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{120ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be divisible by 3. Why? we need the sum of the digits to be divisible by 3, and since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+2+0+0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 3, we need "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be divisible by 3 as well. The digits that are divisible by 3 are 0, 3, 6, and 9. We can test each of these numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{120ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=0, a=3, a=6, a=9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to see whether they are divisible by 7."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12000}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12030}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12060}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12090}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, none of these cases work, so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cannot be 0."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then in order for the number to be divisible by 3, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be equal to 1 (mod 3). The digits that are 1 mod 3 are 1, 4, and 7. We can again test them individually."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12015}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12045}{7}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{12075}{7}=1725"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is an integer! Our answer is, therfore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{75}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alternative method:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
Since 12000 is equal to 2 (mod 7), we need "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be equal to 5 (mod 7) in order for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12000+\overline{ab}=\overline{120ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be divisible by 7. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The numbers less than 100 that are equal to 5 mod 7 are:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"05, 12, 19, 26, 33, 40, 47, 54, 61, 68, 75, 82, 89, \text{ and } 96"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, since we want our number to be divisible by 5, we can eliminate most of these choices: the last digit must be equal to 0 or 5. Now, the numbers that work are"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"05, 40, \text{ and } 75"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we need our number to be divisible by 3. Remember that if the sum of the digits of a number is divisible by 3, then the number is as well. Out of these three numbers, 75 is the only one that is divisible by 3. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Checking our answer, we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12075"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 3, 5, and 7, so our answer is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"75"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(iii)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"iv)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b must either be 5 or 0 since it is a multiple of 5.
a + b must be a multiple of 3 since ab is a multiple of 3.
2000 - ab = multiple of 7. since 14000 - 120ab = 14000 - 12000 - ab
This multiple of 7 can either be 1995, 1960, 1925 since they are multiples of 7 and 5.
If we take ab for each value, we will get 5, 40, 75 respectively. And the only answer that matches multiple of 3 and 5 is actually 75."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To solve this question, we take the number with easier multipliers:5, which is 12005, 12010, 12015, ..., 12095.
Then the multiplier of 3 is known by adding all the digits of the numbers and see if it is divisible by 3. From the numbers 12015 to 12095 which is taken from the number 5 multipliers, only 12015, 12030, 12045, 12060, 12075 and 12090 follows the rule of multiplier 3 and 5, or simply the multiplier of 15.
Let's say 12015 => 1+2+0+1+5=9, which is divisible by 3.
Then from the 6 choices, divide them by 7 and pick the one with no decimal from the division of 7, which is 12075. So the answer should be 75."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have the following equations, using divisibility tests by 3, 5, 7: 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b\equiv 0 (mod 5),a+b\equiv 0 (mod 3), 3a+b+2\equiv 0 (mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then there exists an integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+5k\equiv 0 (\mod 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and this is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+2k\equiv 0(\mod 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\equiv k (\mod 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a+b+2\equiv 0 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" becomes "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a\equiv 5 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The congruence  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a\equiv 5 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" implies  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\equiv 4 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\equiv k (\mod 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (Or 0), so this is a contradiction."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". And so we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The congruence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a+b+2\equiv 0 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" becomes "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3a\equiv 0 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\equiv 0 (\mod 7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But also "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\equiv k (\mod 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\neq 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=7,b=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{ab}=75"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First we note that since a and b are DIGITS, the greatest possible value of the number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{120ab}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 12099"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Also note that the LCM of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3, 5, 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Dividing and taking the floor:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \lfloor \dfrac{12099}{105} \rfloor = 115 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Now multiplying by the LCM, we get:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 115\cdot 105 = 12075 \implies \boxed{75} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and we are done."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If a number is divisible by 5, then the last digit will be either 0 or 5.
b is the last digit and is either 0 or 5.
If a number is divisible by 3, then the sum of the digits of the number should be a multiple of 3.
If b is 0, then 1+2+0+a+0=multiple of 3.
Therefore 'a' can be 0, 3, 6 or 9.
The number could be 12030, 12060, 12060 or 12090.
If b is 5, then 1+2+0+a+5=multiple of 3.
Therefore 'a' can be 1, 4 or 7.
The number could be 12000, 12030, 12060, 12090, 12015, 12045, 12075
Now we could try dividing each number by 7 to see which one is divisible by 7. 12075 is the only number that divides without a remainder and hence its last 2 digits 75 are the answer to this question."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Easier way for smarter people:
If a number is divisible by 3, 5 or 7, it should be divisible by 3"},{"type":"text","text":"5","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"7=105. We can guess about how many times we need to multiply it to get something between 12000 and 12100. We use guessing after that to figure out the answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can find the solution of x^4 + y^4 + z^4  by the following steps:
       (x+y+z)^2    = x^2 + y^2 + z^2 + 2(xy+xz+yz),    so that     (xy+xz+yz) = 66,
    (x+y+z)^3   = x^3 + y^3 + z^3 + 3(xy+xz+yz) (x+y+z) – 3xyx ,    then we find :xyz = 220,
    (xy+xz+yz)^2    = (xy)^2 + (xz)^2 + (yz)^2 + 2xyz(x+y+z),   then we can find    (xy)^2 + (xz)^2 + (yz)^2 = - 924,
    (x^2 + y^2 + z^2)^2 =  x^4 + y^4 + z^4 + 2((xy)^2 + (xz)^2 + (yz)^2),   finally we can find x^4 + y^4 + z^4 = 1992"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} P_1 & = S_1 = 12
\\ P_2 & = S_1P_1 - 2S_2 = 12(12) -2S_2 = 12 & \small \color{#3D99F6} \implies S_2 = 66
\\ P_3 & = S_1P_2 - S_2P_1 + 3S_3 = 12(12) -66(12) + 3S_3 = 12 & \small \color{#3D99F6} \implies S_3 = 220
\\ P_4 & = S_1P_3 - S_2P_2 + S_3P_1 = 12(12) -66(12) + 220(12) = \boxed{1992} 
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
\left.
\begin{aligned}
144&=(x+y+z)^2\\
&=(x^2+y^2+z^2)+2(xy+xz+yz)\\
&=12+2(xy+xz+yz)
\end{aligned}
\right\} \Rightarrow xy+xz+yz=66\\
"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
\left.
\begin{aligned}
792&=(xy+xz+yz)(x+y+z)\\
&=3xyz+[x^2(y+z)+y^2(x+z)+z^2(x+y)]\\
&=3xyz+[x^2(12-x)+y^2(12-y)+z^2(12-z)]\\
&=3xyz+132
\end{aligned}
\right\} \Rightarrow xyz=220\\
"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
\left.
\begin{aligned}
144&=(x^3+y^3+z^3)(x+y+z)\\
&=(x^4+y^4+z^4)+[xy(x^2+y^2)+xz(x^2+z^2)+yz(y^2+z^2)]\\
&=(x^4+y^4+z^4)+[xy(12-z^2)+xz(12-y^2)+yz(12-x^2)]\\
&=(x^4+y^4+z^4)+12(xy+xz+yz)-xyz(x+y+z)\\
&=(x^4+y^4+z^4)+792-2640
\end{aligned}
\right\} \Rightarrow x^4+y^4+z^4=1992\\
"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"My workings isn't as short or as elegant as those that had already posted, but this was how I worked it out."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using Vieta's formulas, where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x, y, z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the roots of a cubic polynomial:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum x = 12 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x + y +z)^2 = x^2 + y^2 + z^2 + 2\sum xy \implies \sum xy = 66 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n = x^n + y^n + z^n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_3 - 12S_2+66S_1 - 3c = 0 \implies c = 220"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the equation is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"w^3 - 12w^2 + 66w - 220 = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we can solve for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_4 = x^4 + y^4 + z^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", by substituting the given equations in the question."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_4 - 12S_3 + 66S_2 - 220S_1 = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_4 = 12(12) - 66(12) + 220(12) = 1992"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2+x^3+y^2+y^3+z^2+z^3 = 24 = 2(x^2+y^2+z^2)
x^2(x+1) + y^2(y+1) + z^2(z+1) = 2x^2+2y^2+2z^2
which implies:
x+1 = 2

z+1 = 2
so all of them are equal to 1.

What gives?
